head.title: National Briefing | Science And Health: Higher Emissions Of Heat-Trapping Gases

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Science And Health: Higher Emissions Of Heat-Trapping Gases

abstract.p: New England Climate Coalition says that emissions of gases that trap heat in atmosphere have risen sharply in New England over past decade and that region wil barely reach one-third of its goals set in 2001 unless stricter controls are enforced (S)

block.p: A report by the New England Climate Coalition says emissions of gases that trap heat in the atmosphere have risen sharply in New England over the past decade and that the region is not on course to meet pollution standards set in 2001. The standards, set in the Regional Climate Change Action Plan, call for emissions of heat-trapping gases to be cut 10 percent by 2020. The advocacy group said the region would barely reach one-third of its goals unless stricter controls were enforced.

The standards, set in the Regional Climate Change Action Plan, call for emissions of heat-trapping gases to be cut 10 percent by 2020. The advocacy group said the region would barely reach one-third of its goals unless stricter controls were enforced.
